item.title: The first signs of burnout are coming from the people who embrace AI the most
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: Because employees could do more, work began bleeding into lunch breaks and late evenings. The employees' to-do lists expanded to fill every hour that AI freed up, and then kept going.

item.title: Databricks CEO says SaaS isn’t dead, but AI will soon make it irrelevant
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: AI isn't going to replace major SaaS apps with vibe-coded versions, Databricks CEO Ali Ghodsi believes. But it could give rise to competitors.

item.title: Anthropic’s India expansion collides with a local company that already had the name
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: India's Anthropic Software has taken the U.S. AI giant to court over a name dispute.

item.title: ChatGPT rolls out ads
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: OpenAI faced a backlash late last year when it tested app suggestions that looked like unwanted ads. Still, the AI company needs to generate revenue from its popular chatbot to cover the costs of developing its technology and growing the business.

item.title: Workday CEO Eschenbach departs, with co-founder Aneel Bhusri returning as CEO
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: Bhusri said in a statement that the company's next chapter would be focused on AI.

item.title: Anthropic closes in on $20B round
item.dc:creator: Tim Fernholz
item.description: The company raised $13 billion in equity funding just five months ago, but intense competition between frontier labs and the ongoing cost of compute have made them eager to raise as quickly as possible.

item.title: Ex-Googlers are building infrastructure to help companies understand their video data
item.dc:creator: Kate Park
item.description: Founded by former Google Japan leaders, InfiniMind is building enterprise AI to turn vast, unused video archives into searchable, actionable business intelligence.

item.title: Call for speakers: TechCrunch Founder Summit 2026
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: Submit to speak at TechCrunch Founder Summit 2026 to lead a roundtable. Share scaling insights with 1,100 founders on June 23 in Boston.

item.title: Crypto.com places $70M bet on AI.com domain ahead of Super Bowl
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: The purchase rewrites the domain record books -- not that the crypto industry has ever been accused of restraint when it comes to spending.

item.title: Okay, I’m slightly less mad about that ‘Magnificent Ambersons’ AI project
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: But this is still a bad idea.

item.title: From Svedka to Anthropic, brands make bold plays with AI in Super Bowl ads
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: From the first AI-generated Big Game ad courtesy of Svedka to Anthropic's beef with OpenAI, here are the biggest ads from Super Bowl LX.

item.title: New York lawmakers propose a 3-year pause on new data centers
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: Although the bill’s prospects are uncertain, New York is at least the sixth state to consider pausing construction of new data centers.

item.title: Benchmark raises $225M in special funds to double down on Cerebras
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: Benchmark Capital has been an investor in the Nvidia rival since 2016.

item.title: It just got easier for Claude to check in on your WordPress site
item.dc:creator: Lucas Ropek
item.description: WordPress users can now leverage Claude to analyze web traffic or find information about other internal site metrics.

item.title: Maybe AI agents can be lawyers after all
item.dc:creator: Russell Brandom
item.description: This week's release of Opus 4.6 shook up the agentic AI leaderboards.

item.title: How Elon Musk is rewriting the rules on founder power
item.dc:creator: Theresa Loconsolo
item.description: Elon Musk has merged SpaceX and xAI, creating what might be the blueprint for a new Silicon Valley power structure. With his $800 billion net worth already rivaling historic conglomerate GE’s peak market cap, and Musk being vocal about his view that “tech victory is decided by velocity of innovation,” the question isn’t whether a personal conglomerate can be built, but rather how far Musk himself is […]

item.title: How far will Elon Musk take the ‘everything’ business as SpaceX and xAI merge?
item.dc:creator: Theresa Loconsolo, Kirsten Korosec, Anthony Ha, Sean O'Kane
item.description: Elon Musk has merged SpaceX and xAI, creating what might be the blueprint for a new Silicon Valley power structure. With his $800 billion net worth already rivaling historic conglomerate GE’s peak market cap, and Musk being vocal about his view that “tech victory is decided by velocity of innovation,” the question isn’t whether a personal conglomerate can be built, but rather how far Musk himself is […]

item.title: The Kindle Scribe Colorsoft is a pricey but pretty e-ink color tablet with AI features
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: If you primarily want a tablet device to mark up, highlight, and annotate your e-books and documents, and perhaps sometimes scribble some notes, Amazon's new Kindle Scribe Colorsoft could be worth the hefty investment.

item.title: How AI is helping solve the labor issue in treating rare diseases
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: At Web Summit Qatar, AI-powered biotech startups describe how automation, data, and gene editing are filling labor gaps in drug discovery and rare disease treatment.

item.title: The backlash over OpenAI’s decision to retire GPT-4o shows how dangerous AI companions can be
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: "You’re shutting him down. And yes — I say him, because it didn’t feel like code. It felt like presence. Like warmth," one user said.
